Fields.DialogueText: Morning to you, Kapitan! I must apologize for it being so dreary down here.
It's a submarine, not a luxury liner, S-3. I wasn't expecting anything different.
I wanted to paint the walls in bright, cheery colors, but military regulation was against such ideas.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think bright colors are needed.
Bright colors should be allowed. That's an outrageous idea.
Maybe regulations will relax somewhat as time goes on.

Fields.DialogueText: But bright colors always cheer me up. And I think they'd energize the crew as well.
Kaapiiitaann, bright colors are cheery and fun!
You think so? Oh, that would be perfect, Kapitan.
I just wish these colors weren't so... depressing. Maybe I can find some colorful fabric or ribbons to improve the interior's appearance.
Hmm? What's that? I'm sensing something, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
It's Morganas.
I won't let them put a damper on my mood.
@BATTLE
Look at this mess.
What mess?
The mess in this supply room. I mean... look at it.
It's not messy, Kapitan! Look, we can find whatever we need - it's all on the floor.
I think a little organization would do us all some good.
I can't do THAT, Kapitan. As soon as I organize a room, I forget where everything is. With THIS system, I can see everything I need.

Fields.MenuText: The floor is NOT a shelf.
This floor is a tripping hazard. Sooner or later, someone is going to hurt themselves.
Well, as long as it isn't hurting anyone...

Fields.DialogueText: This is a submarine, Kapitan. Space needs to be utilized to its fullest potential. The floor can be a shelf if we need it to be one.
The crew will just need to learn to take care with where they step. Consider it a form of discipline.
Da, Kapitan. Cleaning dampens my mood. Doing chores... it's so depressing. I'd rather spend my time having fun.
*ALARM*
Now I have to carefully navigate my way out of this mess... the Morganas might be on top of us before then.
Even better. Then we won't have to waste fuel traveling to them!
@BATTLE
YUCK. Cleaning is not fun. It's boring, it drains the energy out of me...
Just thinking about cleaning has me tired and depressed. I need some sweet toffee to pick me up.
A cookie would do...
Kapitan! Do you have any cookies on you?

Fields.MenuText: A cookie? What do I look like, a baker?
Too many sweets can be bad for you.
Now you have me hungry. I want a cookie.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm just craving something sweet. It would help pick up my mood.
Bad for me? Never! I'll ALWAYS be young and healthy, tee-hee.
We should see if there is something sweet in the galley.
I just love sweets so much, Kapitan. The taste of sugar puts a sunny smile on my face.
*ALARM*
Hmmm... perhaps the Morganas can wait until we find some treats.
I wouldn't get your hopes up.
No? I would wait for them.
I wish that's how war worked...
@BATTLE
I thought there was some toffee around here somewhere...
Kapitan, check under that stack of dishes, would you?
Doesn't anyone clean around here?!
I don't want to force the crew into doing things they don't want to do. It's far more important to have fun together!
I'm not seeing any toffee.
Check the cabinets, the cooler box... hmm, where did I put it last?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe the crew ate all the toffee.
This place is a mess. You'll be lucky to find anything around here.
Is that a dead rat? It looks mummified. How long has it been there?

Fields.DialogueText: If they did, we'll just have to get some more next time we're in port.
Just think of it as a fun scavenger hunt, Kapitan.
That doesn't look good at all. Here, Kapitan, put this ribbon on it. Now, it's a unique decoration.
This isn't good. I'm not seeing any toffee here.
I think this is... a macaroon? How long has this been sitting here?
That's where it ended up! I've been looking for that macaroon.
*ALARM*
I'll eat it while we fight!
@BATTLE
I wish I had toffee... We are all out of sweet treats to eat. I'm STARVING.
What about vegetables?
Vegetables? Those are no fun.
Don't you think you should take just a little more responsibility?
I'm responsible for my crew. If they don't like doing something, I won't force them to do it.
You're... not really what military life has taught me to expect.
Thanks for noticing!
I wish I had a cow in here...
A cow?
Da. Then we would have a fresh supply of milk for toffee at all times. Think of all the toffee we would make if only there was a cow on board.
A cow might be difficult to fit in here.
I can move things around. If a crew member needed space, I would moo-ve things around for them.

Fields.MenuText: I don't like cows...
I like cows, but it just wouldn't fit, S-3.
Think of the mess a cow would make. Who would clean it up?

Fields.DialogueText: Concentrate on the fresh milk, Kapitan. That's what's most important.
I can make the room. Please, let me have a cow, pretty pink bow please? With a sugary delicious cookie on top?
I'm sure... someone would...
*ALARM*
Time to get moo-ving.
@BATTLE
Kaaappiitaaaann, what about a miniature cow?
No cows.
This isn't just any cow, it's smaller. It will take up less space on the ship and there will be less waste for you to clean up.
Me?
Well... you're the authority figure on this ship, and you seem to enjoy responsibility...

Fields.MenuText: I don't like cleaning up others' poor decisions.
You don't give up easily, do you?
A miniature cow sounds cute.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not a poor decision. Think of all the toffee I can make, all the fresh milk I can drink!
Not when it's something I really want.
It will be small and cute! I can name her Dascha.
Just don't let the Soviet Navy know that I have a cow. It can be our secret!
I'll think about it.
*ALARM*
I don't understand why the Morganas can't just leave us alone. They don't give up.
They're just like you trying to obtain a cow.
@BATTLE
What are you doing, Kapitan?
I'm admiring all the manual aspects on this vessel.
Da, Kapitan. I like to keep everything manual and functional.
I can understand that. If there was an electric motor on board, it might cause a fire with all the trash buildup.
I can't help it if the garbage on board builds up rather quickly.

Fields.MenuText: You could try cleaning from time to time.
It's best that most of the workings on this vessel are manual.
Must. Ignore. All. The. Garbage.

Fields.DialogueText: That wouldn't be any fun.
Things are simpler that way, Kapitan.
That's what I do, Kapitan! It keeps my spirits high.
*ALARM*
Blast. I was hoping the Glupyy Flot would leave us alone for a while.
@BATTLE
Even the torpedo launchers are manual?
Da. It keeps everything simple, that way.
Remember, simplicity means a smaller chance of things breaking down. And when things do break, it requires far less effort to get them back in working order.
Have you ever considered upgrading?
I don't see why I should. Things are simple and that keeps me happy. Upgrades require reading manuals and learning new things...
I'd just rather be happy and have fun.

Fields.MenuText: I also want to have fun.
No, upgrading to the most advanced technology is the strategy we must take.
You found what works for you. There's nothing wrong with that.

Fields.DialogueText: Da, Kapitan. There's nothing I love more than dancing over a victory. Hmmm... maybe candy is a bit better. Yes, candy is much better.
I'm not going to learn about all that new stuff, Kapitan. I feel I have enough education as it is.
Da, Kapitan. I like being myself.
*ALARM*
Neizvestniy Flot. The Morganas are no fun. I'm tired of them.
@BATTLE
We need to go to the dairy farm, Kapitan.
I hope we are not buying a cow.
No, there is no cow. Not yet, at least. But we are in need of milk.
I need it to make toffee. The key to a good toffee is milk. Unless it's an English toffee. Then it's butter and almonds.
As long as there is no cow on board, I see no reason why we can't go about getting milk the next time we're in port.
If you keep mentioning it, you'll put ideas into my head, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: No, no cow.
Maybe if you kept the place a bit cleaner, I would consider a cow.
We have much bigger issues to worry about.

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Kapitan. Please?
Why do you have to make these choices so difficult?
I worry about everything my crew does. They want a cow, I can FEEL it.
*ALARM*
Well, isn't that just wonderful?
They're such fun-suckers.
@BATTLE
*glug glug glug*
Ahhhhhhhh.
Germany has the best milk, doesn't it, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: You can say that again. I LOVE German milk.
I'm lactose intolerant. You should have picked up on that by now.
America has far superior milk.

Fields.DialogueText: I think if I were to get a cow, it would be from Germany. Milk is far tastier from a German cow.
Prosti, Kapitan. I guess I forgot. Maybe we should put a ribbon on you? It would cheer ME up.
I don't believe that for a moment. Germany has much better milk than America does.
With this milk, I'll be able to make enough toffee to keep me happy for a month.

Fields.MenuText: Good, that makes me happy.
If only you could be this passionate about keeping this vessel tidy.

Fields.DialogueText: I would do a victory dance to see you happy about something, Kapitan.
That would only depress me. You know how daunting cleaning is in my eyes.
You have a tendency to exaggerate at times, you know that?
That's what happens when I'm craving toffee, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
I wonder if the Morganas act out because they are craving something.
@BATTLE
What are you looking for, S-3?
That book.
What book?
The book with all the recipes. It tells me how to make toffee.
I would have thought you had the recipe memorized.
Why would I need to do that when all the information I need is in the book? Besides, don't you find this education stuff a bit of a bore?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, I find it very uninteresting. I wish I wasn't in charge, but that's life.
Education is key. One can never be too educated.
Does anything involving deep thought interest you?

Fields.DialogueText: When I feel that way, I just let my hair down and have fun. Life is too short to worry about these types of things.
Please! There are tons of uneducated people in the Soviet Union, and they fare just fine.
I try not to think too hard. Philosophy tends to create arguments. I HATE arguments. I would rather have fun!
*ALARM*
Besides, I can't go to school AND try to fight the Morganas. Pick one or the other.
@BATTLE
Are you still looking for that recipe book?
No, I found it...
So what are you looking for?
SUGAR. You can't make toffee without sugar.

Fields.MenuText: If things were a bit more organized, you could find the sugar.
This is too much effort. Just find something else to snack on.
I thought I saw some sugar over in the engine room... Why was it over there?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't blame me, Kapitan. I was never much of a neat and tidy bug.
Everything I want to snack on is sugar-based. You don't expect me to eat a vegetable, you do?
Oh! The crew and I needed something to snack on during our last battle. I hope that it's still there!
*ALARM*
I hope I find my sugar soon. I'll need something to snack on during battle.
You eat raw sugar?
Why not? Snacking is more simple that way.
@BATTLE
How is there even more of a mess?
Da, Kapitan. I'm here.
Explain to me why the galley looks as terrible as it does.
Oh... umm...
Go on.
The crew didn't feel like cleaning, and I wasn't about to force them to do it. I don't want to be a mean leader. I want the crew to like me.

Fields.MenuText: That's not how being a leader works.
Your job is to be respected, not liked.
You're young enough that you could murder someone and the crew would still like you.

Fields.DialogueText: How do I become a leader, then? If it's going to involve hard work, then I don't want any part of it.
That's what YOU think, Kapitan. No one respects you if they don't like you first.
What a great joke, Kapitan! I would never take as big of a risk as that.
This mess is getting out of hand. The galley looks horrid.
Da, Kapitan.
You don't want the crew to suffer food poisoning, do you?
Suffer?
Trust me. If they ingest something that's been improperly stored, they will suffer.
I don't want that.
Then clean this mess up.
Aww, Kapitan, you didn't say the magic words.
Magic words?
Da! Like, “please”...
Please take care of it soon.
*ALARM*
After the Morgana battle.
Even they don't want me to clean.
@BATTLE
Oh, no.
Aah! No, no, no!
What's wrong, Kapitan?
This mess! Just... just look at it!
Do you like what I did with the place?
Why would I like it? Not only did it get worse, but now there are ribbons and bows all over everything.
I thought it would look better than if I cleaned it.
This wasn't the task I assigned you to do.
But you know I can't clean, Kapitan. It depresses me!
Then ask the crew to help!
It depresses them too! And I can't let my crew get depressed. I don't want them thinking that I'm mean.

Fields.MenuText: Why does cleaning give you this debilitating melancholy?
Your bad habits have rubbed off on the crew. You need to set a better example.
Here, I'll start cleaning up this mess...

Fields.DialogueText: It's hard work, and I don't like it. I need to have fun with my life! And hard work just isn't fun.
We have fun together. If they enjoyed hard work, I would go crazy.
Please. Don't do it, Kapitan. It will make my heart explode out of my chest. Let's just let the festive bows sit for a little longer.
*ALARM*
After the battle, the galley needs to be cleaned. Do you understand?
@BATTLE
Now we have all the sugar we could possibly need!
I think just looking at it all might put you at risk for diabetes.
Pssh. You know, some sugar would make a suitable snack right now...

Fields.MenuText: Don't eat raw sugar, S-3.
Hey, share with the captain once in a while.
I hope you're storing that somewhere safe.

Fields.DialogueText: You want some, Kapitan? Here, I can share.
Prosti, Kapitan. I'm so happy to see your sweet tooth make a rare appearance.
Knowing my luck, I might forget about it...
What happens if you misplace this sugar?
Then I'll buy a new bag. And once I do, I'll find the original. Then I'll have two!
*ALARM*
Hold on, Kapitan, just wait a minute. Let me set this bag down.
Don't forget where you're setting that bag...
I'll tie a string around my finger to remind myself!
@BATTLE
I'm so excited! The toffee is finally within my grasp.
All I need to do is take one of these pots out of the sink...
Hey! This pot has rusted all the way through...
That's what happens when you leave a pot in water for an extended period of time.
They were soaking, Kapitan!
Pots don't need to soak to the point of rusting. This is what happens when you don't keep things clean and tidy.
You've never made candy before. The caramelized sugar takes a while to soak out.

Fields.MenuText: I've been making candy longer than you've been alive.
I've never made candy before, but you ought to take my word for it.
I don't think that's a valid excuse for letting the pot rust though.

Fields.DialogueText: But do you make your candy with sugar, Kapitan?
I fear this pot is at the end of its life.
Making candy is hard enough work. You can't expect me to clean the pots too! That wouldn't be fair!
*ALARM*
Here...
You put a ribbon over the hole. What's that going to accomplish?
Now, it doesn't look like a wet blanket of a pot. It looks much more cheerful, don't you agree?
@BATTLE
Spasibo, Kapitan.
I'm thrilled with this new set of pots.
I'm just happy to finally get the garbage out of this vessel. I feel like we finally have room again.
You had plenty of room all along, Kapitan. I occasionally move the garbage around.
At that point, why not just clean the submarine?
Because that's hard work and it will dampen my mood. I want to be happy and have fun.
Speaking of fun, I hear Italy is noted for grape wine.
Though some of the other comrades of the fleet still prefer vodka.

Fields.MenuText: I think wine is the drink of the gods.
I'm with the other Belles. Wine's fairly unpleasant.
If it's all new to you, I think you should probably work your way up to vodka. It's not the best drink for beginners.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I should try some. A little wouldn't hurt, would it?
It's for the best if I follow their advice and stay away from the sauce.
I'm not some random child, Kapitan! I can handle myself just fine.
@BATTLE
Finally, I can make toffee!
And then you'll never, ever have to do it again, right?
Who knows?
But, anyway, I was starting to become resentful towards candy with all the hard work I've been having to put in.

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't say hard work... you had someone else clean this vessel out.
You've worked so hard, you deserve some candy.
I'm just happy there's no cow on board.

Fields.DialogueText: It's all the same, Kapitan. Just watching someone clean is enough to wear me out.
Da, Kapitan! I can't wait to taste the milky, creamy, sweet goodness that melts in my mouth.
Don't worry, Kapitan! I haven't given up on the idea entirely.
Oh no... where is it?
The sugar? It's right here on the counter.
Not the sugar. The milk, Kapitan!
Oh... I didn't know you had set out that milk specifically to make toffee.
You're not going to like this...
What is it?
I saw a crew member drink the milk this morning.
How could you let that happen?!
Now we have to go get more milk again. I wish things weren't so hard on a submarine...
*ALARM*
Now what am I going to do? This day is getting worse by the minute.
@BATTLE
VICTORY!
You're dancing your victory dance.
Da, because we have milk. I can finally make my toffee.
Please don't drink my milk this time, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: I told you, a crew member drank your milk.
Fine, you caught me. I won't drink your milk again.
Nothing is certain in life. I can't go around making promises.

Fields.DialogueText: There's no need to be so defensive. I forgive you.
Please make sure you don't, Kapitan. If you keep drinking it, I will need to bring a cow aboard.
When did you become a nihilist, Kapitan?
*ALARM*
I think you did your victory dance a bit too soon.
Not again! I hope they don't try to steal my toffee.
There might be more valuable assets on this ship other than toffee.
That's talking like an insane person, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
It's my favorite time. Time to make... toffee!
First, we heat the range top.
Hmmm... where did I put those matches? Say, Kapitan, do you have a light?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I have a light. A smoker is never without one.
No, I don't smoke. That stuff will kill you, mark my words.
Sorry, I can't smoke in a submarine. The area is too enclosed for me to do so comfortably.

Fields.DialogueText: Spasibo, Kapitan. I knew I could count on you.
I'm going to have to find a match, then...
I won't tell you that some of the crew members smoke when aboard, then...
Oh, wait. Never mind, I don't need a match after all. I forgot I keep a match in my hair for just such an occasion.
At this point, that doesn't surprise me.
Now that the range is lit, we add the sugar and heat it up until it caramelizes.
After that, we add in the milk and stir.
Making candy by hand isn't considered work?
Why would it be? I like the simplicity of the activity.
Let it cool down slowly...
Smell that aroma. It's almost like a toffee spirit is in the room with us. I can't wait to taste it.
*ALARM*
Maybe this will give the toffee some time to cool off.
@BATTLE
What is that you have in your hand?
Toffee, Kapitan. Sweet, sweet toffee.
Would you like some?

Fields.MenuText: You know I don't like eating sweets.
Ehh... I don't trust your toffee, sorry.
Yes, I'd love to sample some of this much talked about toffee.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Kapitan. It's hard to remember the fine details, sometimes. I remember now. Don't mind me eating, then.
What do you mean you don't trust it? The milk was fresh from the cow. Nothing's expired in the ice box since I had it cleaned out in Italy.
Don't eat it all, Kapitan. You need to save enough for me.
I just LOVE toffee. This, this right here, is the food of the gods. Or the food of this Belle, at least.
*NOM NOM NOM*
Don't eat it too fast. You'll get a stomach ache.
I've never had one before. I think I'll be fine.
*ALARM*
Are you taking the toffee with you into battle?
After all the effort required of me to make this toffee... a snack will keep my energy up during the battle.
@BATTLE
URRRGGGG!
WAAAAAA!
What's wrong?
Kapitan, I think I've taken ill. I feel like I'm dying!
You're not dying. You just ate too much toffee.
Toffee never bothered me like that before.
Have you ever eaten this much before?
I can't remember. I don't keep a detailed log of the fun I have. If I did, it wouldn't be fun - it would be work!
Urrrggg, Kapitan, my belly! I'm dying. Help me!

Fields.MenuText: Hang in there. I'll get you something for it.
Let this be a lesson, S-3. There is too much of a good thing.
I think I'm getting a belly ache by proxy.

Fields.DialogueText: Please, hurry. I don't know how much more agony I can take.
I don't want to hear a lesson at this time, Kapitan. My belly hurts and I'm too sad...
Kapitan, not you too! This is spoiling my night. Please get me some medicine.
Hold tight, I'll get you something.
URRGGG! I'm dying, the light is fading. I'm too young to die!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Here, drink this.
What is this fizzy sorcery?
It's an effervescent antacid. The bubbles will help relieve your stomach pain.
*glug glug*
I hope sweet release comes soon. Kapitan, I'm too young to die.

Fields.MenuText: You're not going to die. Just wait a bit for the medicine to take effect.
If you were gone, the ship might be cleaner...
You can't die after I went to the effort of getting you this medicine.

Fields.DialogueText: Why did you let me eat all that toffee, Kapitan?
Why did you let me eat all that toffee, Kapitan?
Why did you let me eat all that toffee, Kapitan?
Don't put the blame on me, Miss All Fun and No Work.
You're the responsible one in this submarine! You should have stopped me.

Fields.MenuText: You convinced me you were capable of eating quantities of candy that no mortal would be able to ingest.
You're right. I should have cut you off.
Can I get you to put that in writing?

Fields.DialogueText: ... I think the medicine is taking effect.
... I think the medicine is taking effect.
... I think the medicine is taking effect.
Do you feel better?
I feel like death is being staved off... but I wouldn't say better yet.
Good, because we have Morganas to fight!
@BATTLE
Huh, there's a ribbon on the wall. Let me just take a closer look...
Hey, this is hiding a crack in the paint.
What is it, Kapitan?
Why did you put this ribbon over this crack?
I didn't like seeing it... I think the ribbon makes it more enjoyable to look at.
Why didn't you have the crew fix this crack?
You know I won't force them. I love my crew and I don't want them to do anything they don't feel like doing.
How would you feel if a parent told you to fix an issue?

Fields.MenuText: I would feel fine, and fix it without hesitation.
I don't like parental authority. I would probably put a ribbon over it too.
I would fix it. Not to please my parents, but because I don't want to drown.

Fields.DialogueText: Then you should fix it, Kapitan. Come on, it will put a smile on everyone's faces.
It's not hurting anyone, is it? Ribbons are nice and fanciful.
Kapitan, you sound just like a parent. Think of something less strict... please?
*ALARM*
See? The crack can wait, Kapitan. The Morganas wouldn't want to hit a beat-up vessel, would they?
You need to be educated in how far people will go in war.
No books, please... thinking hard is too much work.
@BATTLE
What's that you have in your hand?
Oh, it's just some toffee.
You didn't swear off toffee?
Why would I?
You were claiming being on death's door from all the toffee you ate.
That was in the past. I was craving something sweet. Toffee is my favorite treat.

Fields.MenuText: Even after the belly ache?
I think I'm having a belly ache.
Give me some of that toffee.

Fields.DialogueText: That belly ache was in the past. I am over it. I am nimble, adaptable and agile.
Take some of that medicine, Kapitan. It worked for me.
Don't hog it all, Kapitan! Save some for me.
What's wrong, Kapitan? You don't look well. Did this toffee make you sick?

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry about me. I'm having a pretty good time right now.
Let's just say I clearly can't eat as much of the stuff as you can.
